p: A 0.1 OD 600 of the different overnight bacterial cultures was swabbed on a 25 mL LB agar plate. Whatman disk was then placed on the plates. A 30 µL sample of different solvent extracts of L. pubescens was added to the sterilized disk (Whatman No. 1 paper, 6 mm diameter) and incubated overnight at 37 °C. For screening of the different plant organs, the powdered samples were dissolved in ethyl acetate, and the resulting extract was added to the Whatman disk. Streptomycin (250 µg/mL) was used as the standard antibacterial agent. The experiment was performed in triplicate.
